title: Group X - Pilates
description:
Group X classes are free, 45-minute long sessions that feature a variety of different formats, focusing on concepts like cardio, muscular strength and endurance, and flexibility. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 No registration required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID. 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Wednesday, 09/02 - 12/17 
 9:45am - 10:30am 
 Student Recreation Multi-Purpose Room 
 
 Instructor 
 
 Maddie

title: Breakfast in Blanton
description:
Start your day right with Breakfast in Blanton. A cozy morning event with free food, good vibes, and a chance to connect with your fellow residents! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Walk with the President during International Education Week!
description:
In celebration of  International Education Week , President Koppell invites his fellow RedHawks to join him for an informal walk around campus on  Wednesday, November 19, from 11:00 to 12:00 p.m.  This is a wonderful opportunity to share your experiences, discuss your studies, and talk about your aspirations and dreams in a relaxed setting. The walk will include stops that highlight the spirit of international education and will conclude at the  Student Center. 
   
 Register using the following link:   https://forms.gle/ RLJoW46UCYJe8NYw6

title: Free Swim Lessons - Intermediate
description:
Take your swimming to the next level! Get introduced to new strokes or work on the ones you already know. These lessons are for swimmers who are a little more comfortable in the water but still want to improve their technique and expand what skills they know.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Swimming unassisted on your front and back  
 Improve treading (in the deep end) 
 Improving breath control in the water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Dolphin Kick) 
 Introduction to and/or improving your breaststroke 
 Swimming laps 
 Introduction to open and flip turns 
 Introduction to Butterfly 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Wednesday:11-12 PM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Blind Date With a Book Sale
description: Stop by Delta Xi Deltas Blind Date With A Book Sale! No authors, no titles - only a genre and short description! It's all about the mystery :)

title: [H&H Week 2025] COV 101: Covenant House Presentation
description:
Since 1989, Covenant House New Jersey has provided housing and supportive services for youth experiencing homelessness. What began as a commitment to shelter and support has grown into a powerful movement—one that offers safety, healing, and opportunity to young people facing homelessness and survivors of human trafficking. 
 Learn more about how their work transforms lives! 
   
 *This event counts for service hours.*

title: Feminist Scholars and Global Advocacy at the United Nations
organization: Bloomfield Office of International Student Services
location: Shelby Art Room at Bloomfield College Library
description: Join us for an inspiring panel discussion featuring feminist scholars engaged in global advocacy at the United Nations!  Through their stories and experiences, explore how knowledge, passion, and collaboration advance gender equality across borders. All are welcome!

title: Office of Global Engagement Presents: Thanksgiving Lunch
description:
Join the Office of Global Engagement for a traditional American Thanksgiving meal on Wednesday, November 19 at 12:00pm. We will play games, eat well, and share what we are thankful for with new friends! This event is for current students ONLY, please do not bring any guests. 
 Must RSVP, space is limited!

title: Psychology Lab Open House
organization: College of Humanities and Social Sciences (CHSS)
description:
Psychology Lab Open House Wednesday, Nov. 19 from 12–3 PM  Dickson Hall, Cohen Lounge Get more information & a map to participating labs here. 
 For one day, our labs will be open for visitors! This event is open to undergraduate and graduate students across Montclair and Bloomfield campuses. 
   
 • Learn what Psychology labs and clinics do • Meet faculty & student researchers • Explore which labs you are interested in • Find out which groups are seeking research assistants

title: Kcla fall treats
description: Come stop by and grab some fall treats in university lobby!

title: Bible Talk
location: University Hall 1070 - Phyllis & Gerald LeBoff Lecture Hall
description: Public bible discussion open to all who are looking to grow in their relationship with God / Jesus. It's a great opportunity to come with questions and engage with students also looking to develop their faith. This is typically a 30 minute discussion (with snacks).

title: Podcast Meeting
description: Discuss ideas with our podcast team to be featured on our student-run podcast!

title: General Body Meetings
description: Join us for a WOCA General Body Meeting — a space to share, connect, and have a good time! Open to all students.

title: Little Library Painting Part 2
description: Join the Apple Core Community as we finish painting our Little Libraries! Leave a piece of yourself on the shelf.

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Midweek Series - Chamber Music Recital
description:
Cali Midweek Series: Chamber Music Recital 
 Students perform works from the classical and contemporary repertoire. 
 Cali Midweek Concerts 2025-26 Most Wednesdays at 2 PM Chapin Hall, Leshowitz Recital Hall 
 FREE ADMISSION! 
 Join us for the  Cali Midweek Concerts at Montclair State University’s John J. Cali School of Music , where we bring a diverse array of musical performances and educational events every Wednesday at 2PM in Leshowitz Recital Hall, Chapin Hall. Our concert series showcases the immense talent within our faculty, students, and esteemed guest artists. 
 FULL SCHEDULE:  https://www.montclair.edu/music/cali-midweek-series-schedule/

title: CSAM Science Teaching Program - Program Meeting
description:
The  CSAM Science Teaching Program  holds  biweekly meetings  that are open, welcoming, and inclusive! Any student curious about science teaching is invited to join us. Each meeting highlights a theme related to science education, from classroom strategies to career pathways, and offers students opportunities to connect with mentors, explore internships, and gain real-world experience working with teachers and children. Students are encouraged to  bring a guest  who may also be interested in exploring science teaching. 
 These gatherings help us build a strong  community of support , where students encourage one another, share experiences, and access valuable opportunities such as  scholarships, paid internships, and mentoring  from advanced peers and in-service science teachers. Whether you are just beginning to explore the idea of teaching or already on the path toward certification, these meetings are a place to grow, learn, and belong.

title: Marketing Club Guest Speaker: Javier Farfan

title: Caribbean Student Organization General. Body Meetings
description: Join the Caribbean Student Organization for our upcoming meeting! We celebrate Caribbean culture, community, and heritage while creating a space for students to connect, share ideas, and get involved on campus. All are welcome — whether you’re Caribbean or just interested in learning more!

title: General Body Meeting
description: GBM with e-board and the organization members

title: UAASO General Body Meeting
location: University Hall 1020 - Bard-Blount Family Lecture Hall
description: Our weekly general body meeting where you get to learn about different Asian cultures and connect with others who are also interested in the culture!

title: De-Stress and Gratitude Craft Session
description:
Take a break before Thanksgiving and join CAPS & the Segal Gallery Staff for a cozy, creative afternoon focused on gratitude through crafting. 
 Enjoy hands-on crafts, relaxing music, and a chance to pause and reflect on what you’re thankful for this season. Stop by anytime between 1:30 & 3:30. All materials provided — just bring yourself and a friend.
